page.title: 05PORTHMADOG AREA FARMS
page.content: Most of the farms come under the category of enclosed rough grazing, stocked with sheep and cattle,with some fields kept for hay to provide fodder for winter keep.The reclaimed land above the Cob consists of some rough and some cultivated grassland, also wetland which includes a Site of Special Scietific Interest between the Toll Gate and Ynys Gron Quarry.The estuary of the river Glaslyn provides trout and salmon fishing.On the seaward side of the Cob salmon is netted in the harbour and there is a limmited amount of mussel farming. {FARMS:with enclosed rough grazing: Tyddyn Llwyn,Pen Clogwyn,Tuhwntirbwlch Penrhyn Isaf,Lloc Meurig(with hay). {With grazing & woodland:}Deudraeth, Borth Wen Bach,Abergafran.{With rough {grazing:}Llety Bryn Tirion,Plas Newydd,Traeth Cwrt Isaf(and wetland)
